page.title: 19Shouldham-The School.2
page.content: The school has eleven governors, with Rev.G.Hamey as Chairman and Mr.C.Mummer as Clerk. They meet at least once a term. The future of the school,as with many other schools in Norfolk,is uncertain as the Education Committee have recently put forwards some guidelines, suggesting that the curriculum in small schools is inadequate and that a reasonable number of teachers for a primary school should be 7 with 160+ pupils. This would mean the wholesale closure of over 100 primary schools in Norfolk and sound the death knell to village community life. A possible solution to this problem may be the amalgamation of small schools,rather than transporting the children to the nearest town with the resultant effect of the disappearance of village life.
